intro: Geranium modestum, commonly known as the modest geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring upright stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink or red, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its botanical characteristics make it both ornamental and useful in ecological landscaping.
